poem:
**Double Chocolate Reverie**

Beneath the morning sun,  
a tart of indulgence gleams —  
rich, but no nuts!  
O, brownie purist,  
how your heart yields today  
to the crunch  
of the biscuit base,  
the tangy sweetness —  
creme fraiche cuts deep,  
salted whispers soothe  
the chocolate evermore.  
A morning's bite,  
a poet's delight.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Benjamina Ebuehi’s recipe for double chocolate brownie tart | The sweet spot This is one for the chocolate lovers (myself included). It’s rich and indulgent, which is why I love it. I can be a bit of a brownie purist – no nuts, ever! – but here I make an exception. The biscuit base stays nice and crunchy, while the tangy, salted creme fraiche topping cuts through some of the richness. You can serve this". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
